Utils Functions¶

Here can be found the implementation of the auxiliary functions for the implementation of the architectures.

pyCNN_LSTM.utils.TimeDistributed(module) TimeDistributed module implementation.
pyCNN_LSTM.utils.flip_indices_for_conv_to_lstm(x) Changes the (N, C, L) dimension to (N, L, C).
pyCNN_LSTM.utils.flip_indices_for_conv_to_lstm_reshape(x) Changes the (N, C, L) dimension to (N, L, C).
pyCNN_LSTM.utils.check_inputs(include_top, …) Auxiliar function for checking the input parameters of the models.
pyCNN_LSTM.utils.full_convolution(x, …) It performs a Full convolution operation on the given keras Tensor.
pyCNN_LSTM.utils.TimeDistributed(module)[source]¶

TimeDistributed module implementation.

pyCNN_LSTM.utils.flip_indices_for_conv_to_lstm(x: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor[source]¶

Changes the (N, C, L) dimension to (N, L, C). This is due to features in PyTorch’s LSTMs are expected on the last dim.

pyCNN_LSTM.utils.flip_indices_for_conv_to_lstm_reshape(x: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor[source]¶

Changes the (N, C, L) dimension to (N, L, C). This is due to features in PyTorch’s LSTMs are expected on the last dim.

pyCNN_LSTM.utils.check_inputs(include_top, weights, input_tensor, input_shape, classes, classifier_activation)[source]¶

Auxiliar function for checking the input parameters of the models.

pyCNN_LSTM.utils.full_convolution(x, filters, kernel_size, **kwargs)[source]¶

It performs a Full convolution operation on the given keras Tensor.
